stork.feather

Class Pump

  • java.lang.Object
    • ProxyElement
      • stork.feather.Pump

  • public abstract class Pump
extends ProxyElement
    A Pump is an adapter over a passive Tap allows it to be used where an active Tap is required. A Tap emits Slices to an attached Sink. The tap should provide methods for regulating the flow of data (see #pause() and #resume()) to allow attached sinks to prevent themselves from being overwhelmed.

    Taps may be either active or passive, as declared by the return value of #isActive(). A passive Tap may be converted into an active Tap by #attach()ing a Pump.

    See Also:
    Sink, Slice

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public final ProxyTransfer attach(Sink sink)
        Attach this tap to a sink. Once this method is called, #start() will be called and the tap may begin emitting Slices.
        Parameters:
        sink - a Sink to attach.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sink is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is a sink has already been attached.
